intro: Guajava berteroana, commonly known as the white guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit, which is typically small and round, has a fragrant aroma and a sweet, juicy pulp. The botanical features of Guajava berteroana make it a valuable species for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
